headline: U.S. credit scores suffer largest 2-year drop since Great Recession
summary: The new national average is 715, down from 718 two years ago, as household debt climbs and inflation bites.

headline: Student loan delinquencies hit record high, FICO report says
summary: Borrowers haven't been paying back their student loans. Now delinquencies are at their highest rate on record — and credit scores are suffering

raw.headline: Student loan delinquencies hit record high, FICO report says
raw.summary: Borrowers haven't been paying back their student loans. Now delinquencies are at their highest rate on record — and credit scores are suffering

headline: US consumers are feeling the stress of inflation, interest rates, report shows
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Some U.S. consumers are showing increased signs of stress as inflation and higher interest rates are affecting affordability and leading to financial strain on borrowers, credit scoring company Fair Isaac Corporation, widely known as FICO, said on Tuesday.  The overall national FICO score has dipped slightly by about 2 points.  Gen Z adults in the U.S. - those currently in their teens and 20s - have seen the sharpest decrease in their scores, driven by student loan pressure.

headline: Average FICO score sheds two points in 2025. Who's seeing the largest drop?
summary: The national average FICO score fell, reflecting diffculties Americans face in staying financially afloat. See which group is seeing the largest drop.

headline: FICO Releases Inaugural FICO Score® Credit Insights Report Highlighting Major Shifts in Consumer Credit
summary: BOZEMAN, Mont., September 16, 2025--FICO (NYSE:FICO), the leading analytics software company, today released its inaugural FICO® Score Credit Insights report—a first-of-its-kind analysis offering a detailed look at how consumer credit behaviors are evolving across the United States. With FICO Scores used by 90% of top U.S. lenders, the findings provide critical visibility into how Americans are managing credit. The report highlights how inflation, resumed student loan payments, and evolving paym
